actions.args: {"id": 61, "body": {"name": "NEAR Campus Challenge: Workshops and Ideathon-to-Hackathon Series ", "summary": "The NEAR Campus Challenge empowers Kenyan university students through workshops, ideathons, and a final hackathon focused on NEAR Protocol. This series will enhance practical blockchain skills, foster innovation, and grow the NEAR developer community by introducing fresh, talented developers ready to build on NEAR\\\\\\'s unique capabilities.\\\\n\\\\n", "category": "Universities & Bootcamps", "timeline": {"status": "REJECTED", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "bpolania.near", "description": "**Event Introduction**\\\\n\\\\nNEAR Campus Challenge: Workshops and Ideathon-to-Hackathon Series in Kenya is a comprehensive series designed to immerse university students in the innovative world of NEAR Protocol. This series will kick off with engaging workshops at three prestigious universities in Kenya, where students will learn the fundamentals of blockchain and specifically how to utilize NEAR Protocol\\\\\\'s features for building decentralized applications. Following the workshops, each university will host an ideathon, challenging students to conceptualize and propose impactful projects using NEAR Protocol. Winners from these ideathons will advance to a competitive hackathon, where they will develop their projects with expert guidance and compete for prizes. This initiative targets not only computer science and engineering students but also developers and tech enthusiasts eager to explore blockchain technology\\\\\\'s potential.\\\\n\\\\n**Organizer Introduction**\\\\n\\\\nCryptoGalaxy is organized by a dedicated team of blockchain enthusiasts and professionals committed to advancing blockchain technology in Kenya and across Africa. Our team brings a diverse range of expertise and experience to the NEAR Campus Challenge:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n1.Victor Gunga is a passionate community advocate for Arbitrum and Graph Protocol. His experience includes hosting the Arbitrum campus tours and coordinating hackathons, significantly contributing to the growth and engagement of the blockchain developer community. \\\\nLinkedIn : https://www.linkedin.com/in/victorgunga/\\\\nTwitter: https://twitter.com/vicgunga\\\\n\\\\n2.Zuhura Kimani is the founder of LedgerLady, a community organization dedicated to empowering women through blockchain education. She has been instrumental in onboarding women into Web3, providing them with necessary resources and educational materials. Zuhura has extensive experience hosting events for major blockchain platforms such as Arbitrum, TON, and Solana. \\\\nLinkedIn : https://www.linkedin.com/in/zuhura-kimani-1a192927a/\\\\n Twitter: https://twitter.com/ledgerlady_\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n3.Nashons Agate is at the forefront of blockchain application in financial solutions, currently leading the development of Nexuspay, a stablecoin-based payment system for African countries. Nashons has a strong background in community building, having successfully hosted the Flow meetup in Kenya. \\\\nLinkedIn : https://www.linkedin.com/in/nashons-agate-165683226/\\\\n Twitter: https://twitter.com/agatenash\\\\n\\\\n**Previous Events\\\\n**\\\\nArbitrum Nairobi Meetup\\\\nLink: https://twitter.com/vicgunga/status/1764269130021040160?t=qxpLKuWTO1PrzGkO2BGT0Q&s=19\\\\nAttendance: 84\\\\nSponsor: Arbitrum Foundation\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nSolana Nairobi Meetup\\\\nLink: https://twitter.com/vicgunga/status/1771829710969802907?t=JGu81UqI5I58MbWlDY7svQ&s=19\\\\nAttendance: 42\\\\nSponsor: Solana Foundation\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nICP Zetech University Meetup\\\\nLink: https://twitter.com/cryptogalaxy254/status/1730923908612694351?t=BDQVYSZdjywU9K86znhF0g&s=19\\\\nAttendance: 117\\\\nSponsor: ICP\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nChainlink Smartcon Watchparty 2023\\\\nLink: https://twitter.com/doyeninit/status/1711734406291845444?t=TSkwJ651Mat6InYAYXdjYA&s=19\\\\nAttendance: 30\\\\nSponsor: Chainlink\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nGnosis Nairobi Meetup\\\\nLink: https://twitter.com/GriffinOduol/status/1673251261498507264?t=kxXG4NWn0C2PYw7iuOAZRQ&s=19\\\\nAttendance: 50\\\\nSponsor: Gnosis Builders\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nGnosis Ethsafari Side Event\\\\nLink: https://twitter.com/W3E_Kenyan/status/1706240688307007770?t=lb6-qrsHgwA-5TU_8BNdNg&s=19\\\\nAttendance: 96\\\\nSponsor: Gnosis Builders\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nGnosis Builders Kenya Hackathon\\\\nLink: https://twitter.com/W3E_Kenyan/status/1686255071862878209?t=VOmggozRhP8Mja9KZHYnEw&s=19\\\\nAttendance: 23\\\\nSponsor: Gnosis Builders\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nFlow Nairobi Meetup\\\\nLink: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1-2TbDFBpnapIwVmq36MNR2zea0L8619h?usp=sharing\\\\nAttendance: 88\\\\nSponsor: Flow\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nTON Nairobi Meetup\\\\nLink: https://twitter.com/ledgerlady_/status/1771461104343888340?t=KrBPtk9spD9KHgw7uoMH1A&s=19\\\\nAttendance: 79\\\\nSponsor: TON foundation\\\\n\\\\n**Event Impact**\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nThe NEAR Campus Challenge is specifically designed to catalyze the growth and development of future blockchain professionals in Kenya. By focusing on NEAR Protocol, this event series aims to achieve several impactful outcomes:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nDeveloper Skill Enhancement: Through comprehensive workshops and ideathons, participants will gain hands-on experience with NEAR Protocol\\\\\\'s technology. This includes understanding and utilizing its unique features such as sharding for scalability, low transaction fees, and a user-friendly development environment. These skills are crucial for building efficient and innovative decentralized applications.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nFostering Innovation: The event encourages students to think creatively about the applications of blockchain technology. By engaging in project-based learning and competitive development, participants will be equipped to contribute original ideas and solutions to the NEAR ecosystem, potentially leading to breakthroughs in blockchain application.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nCommunity Building: By bringing together students from various universities, the event will foster a strong community of NEAR developers in Kenya. This network will support ongoing collaboration and shared learning, strengthening the local blockchain ecosystem and ensuring sustained engagement with NEAR Protocol.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nCareer Opportunities: Participants will gain visibility among leading companies and startups within the blockchain industry. The practical experience and networking opportunities provided by the event can open doors to internships, job offers, and collaborative projects, accelerating professional growth in the technology sector.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nEnhancing NEAR Protocol\\\\\\'s Reach: As participants learn to develop on NEAR, they will naturally expand the protocol\\\\u{2019}s adoption and utilization, contributing to its growth and the diversification of its applications. This helps fulfill NEAR\\\\u{2019}s mission of empowering people with accessible, scalable, and user-friendly blockchain solutions.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)\\\\n**\\\\n\\\\nParticipant Engagement:\\\\nTotal Attendees: Aim to engage at least 800 participants across all events, including workshops, ideathons, and the hackathon.\\\\nActive Developers: Register a minimum of 200 students actively participating in the development challenges and submitting projects.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nEducational Outcomes:\\\\nWorkshop Completion: Ensure at least 80% of participants complete the workshop series, gauged through post-workshop assessments.\\\\n\\\\nInnovation and Project Development:\\\\nProjects Submitted: Target the submission of at least 50 distinct projects that utilize NEAR Protocol\\\\\\'s technology.\\\\nQuality Projects: Have at least 10 projects qualify for potential incubation or further development support by NEAR or associated partners.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nCommunity Impact:\\\\nNew NEAR Accounts: Creation of at least 300 new NEAR wallet accounts by participants.\\\\nOngoing Community Engagement: Establish a follow-up program where at least 50% of the participants continue engaging with the NEAR community through forums, subsequent events, or NEAR-related projects.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nFeedback and Satisfaction:\\\\nParticipant Satisfaction Rate: Achieve a participant satisfaction rate of 85% or higher, measured through post-event surveys.\\\\nPartner Feedback: Collect and evaluate positive feedback from sponsors and partners involved in the event.\\\\n\\\\n**Evaluation Factors**\\\\nProjects will be assessed based on:\\\\n\\\\nIntegration and innovative use of NEAR Protocol\\\\u{2019}s features.\\\\nTeam diversity and effectiveness.\\\\nMarket potential and alignment with blockchain trends.\\\\nTechnical proficiency and execution.\\\\nScalability and potential for real-world application.\\\\n\\\\n**Budget Breakdown**\\\\nWorkshop Budget (Per Campus):\\\\nSpace: $200\\\\nFood: $400\\\\nInternet: $50\\\\nPhotography: $100\\\\nBanners and Event Material: $150\\\\nAudio Visual: $100\\\\nTotal per Campus: $1000\\\\nTotal for 3 Campuses: $3000\\\\n\\\\nHackathon Budget:\\\\nSpace: $400\\\\nFood: $450\\\\nInternet: $50\\\\nPhotography: $100\\\\nBanners and Event Material: $150\\\\nAudio Visual: $150\\\\nTotal for Hackathon: $1300\\\\n\\\\nRewards and Stipends:\\\\nIdeathon Rewards: $600 per university x 3 = $1800\\\\nHackathon Rewards: $3000\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nGrand Total: $9,100\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "vicgunga.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "9100", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": []}

{"id": 35, "body": {"name": "Free-to-Use Aggregator Dashboard For the Near Community", "summary": "Alphaday helps solve the issue of information fragmentation. We aim to serve as a central point where any user (developer, investor, etc) can instantly get the Near information they need and stay up to date.\\\\n\\\\nActive Users: ~15,000 MAU (organic) \\\\nAverage Session Time Per User: 9 minutes\\\\nRetention Rate Across 1/7/30 Days: 56%/53%/50%\\\\n\\\\nEstablished Partners: Aave, Chiliz, TheGraph, Avalanche, Metis, Dfinity, Zcash, XRPL, Ethereum Classic, RocketPool, Starknet and others.", "category": "Engagement & Awareness", "timeline": {"status": "REJECTED", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "bpolania.near", "description": "We would like to create a Near ecosystem dashboard that aggregates the following information into a single community dashboard:\\\\n\\\\n- The latest Near official announcements and blog post content.\\\\n- A feed of all news mentions of Near from coindesk, cointelegraph and 20+ other news sources aggregated from across the internet.\\\\n- A calendar containing all Near events including Governance votes, meetups, conferences, hackathons with bounties, AMAs.\\\\n- Podcast feed featuring Near.\\\\n- Youtube stream containing educational Near content.\\\\n- Integration with Near Governance Forum to show the latest and trending discussion topics.\\\\n- Discord & Reddit Integration to show a feed of latest discussions.\\\\n- FAQ, Whitepaper, NEAR tokenomics information.\\\\n- Live NEAR spot price chart.\\\\n- Comprehensive list of Developer tools, API\\\\u{2019}s, tutorials, guides, brand toolkit, grants & bounties, documentation, technical papers, and any other resources that can help build on Near.\\\\n- Near Careers integration to show the latest open jobs listed.\\\\n- Near TVL data through Defillama integration.\\\\n- A widget featuring the Near roadmap (Plans for 2024) with all the descriptions included.\\\\n- Categorized links and descriptions of products and services offered in the Near ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\nWe should be able to build and deploy the above dashboard within 1-2 months so if this grant is approved we want to launch the Near dashboard by June 1st, 2024 (tentatively).\\\\n\\\\nThereafter, we will maintain & curate the dashboard on a regular basis, as well as improve the functionality and availability of features in our application as a whole.\\\\n\\\\nExample of dashboard built for Aave through a grant agreement: https://app.alphaday.com/b/aave/\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "bff3b9a1e53713ffe55308da1e0f00ff33087ffd4e3bd73f45736bb335176df8", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "4000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": []}

{"id": 20, "body": {"name": "Edu Warriors is a student-led movement, aiming to be a global platform", "summary": "EDU Warriors, a group of dedicated educators, enhances learning with aids in coding and blockchain. We recently held a technical workshop in Mumbai for 250 participants, led by alumni involved in social causes. Since 2021, we\\\\\\'ve focused on web3, blockchain, and metaverse topics in our boot camps, attracting 400 students to our August 2023 event. Serving over 30,000 students, we plan to host more events and boot camps.", "category": "Events & Hackathons", "timeline": {"status": "REJECTED", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "bpolania.near", "description": "**Intro:** I am Meena Mishra, an educator, and an award-winning author. I teach at school and also conduct workshops for students on Literature, Language, and Technology. Since 2021, we have introduced blockchain, web3, metaverse, and cryptos. I have been watching how Near Ecosystem works and would like to propose to onboard my community to get better reach, learn, and contribute to the system.\\\\n\\\\n**PROPOSAL:** EDU Warriors, a group of dedicated educators, enhances learning with aids in coding and blockchain. We recently held a technical workshop in Mumbai for 250 participants, led by alumni involved in social causes. Since 2021, we\\\\\\'ve focused on web3, blockchain, and metaverse topics in our boot camps, attracting 400 students to our August 2023 event. Serving over 30,000 students, we plan to host more events and boot camps.\\\\n\\\\n**ROAD MAP:**`April 2024 - June 2024`\\\\n\\\\n- We\\\\\\'ve scheduled 4 boot camps and 3 workshops focusing on Blockchain, Cryptos, and the Metaverse.\\\\n- Already, 1000 students have registered for these workshops.\\\\n\\\\n**What\\\\\\'s in the pipeline for Near?**\\\\n\\\\n- Our goal is to welcome these students into the NEAR ECOSYSTEM, offering insight into how an L1 chain operates, and assisting in NFT minting.\\\\n- We\\\\\\'ve consulted with Near University materials and video content, which we\\\\\\'ll incorporate into the workshop.\\\\n- Our strategy is to engage a group of 1000 students, providing them with resources and teaching them how to navigate the platform, create NFTs, and contribute positively to the ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\n`June 2024 - August 2024`\\\\n\\\\n- We\\\\\\'ll host an event allowing these students to gain firsthand experience with the Near Ecosystem.\\\\n- Our emphasis will be on enabling these students to create NFTs and future DApps.\\\\n\\\\n**Target: **\\\\n\\\\n- We plan to onboard 3000 students to NearEcosystem\\\\n- 3000 Students to the NEAR Ecosystem with their wallets, custom wallet names.\\\\n- We plan to have bounties and contests to engage our community members.\\\\n- We will have free NFTs for new people\\\\n -\\\\u{a0}*Onboarding of new members and new nfts etc*\\\\n    - Metrics for measuring success:\\\\u{a0}*We have plans of having over 3000+ students joining the ecosystem by June 2024*\\\\n    - Estimated timeline and achievement milestones\\\\u{a0}*June 2024*\\\\n\\\\n**Funding: **\\\\nWe required $3500 USD\\\\n\\\\nFunding breakdown:\\\\n\\\\n- Venue Cost: $400 (For three different locations)\\\\n- Material Printing Cost: $300 (For notepads, pens, printed materials, whiteboards, markers, etc.)\\\\n- Refreshments: $200 (For tea/coffee and snacks during workshops)\\\\n- Promotional Material: $400 (For banners and posters displayed across the venue and local institutions)\\\\n- Social Media Promotion: $300 (For digital banners and posters on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter)\\\\n- Participant Goodies: $400 (For items like stickers, badges, notebooks, t-shirts, etc. for top performers)\\\\n- WEB#3 Space: $500 (For creating Near wallets, Mintbase/Paras accounts, and student onboarding)\\\\n- Rewards: $1000 (For bounties, rewards, and recognition)\\\\n\\\\nI am enthusiastic about this opportunity and eagerly anticipate your support.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nPleasse note:  I\\\\\\'ve been an active contributor and promoter in the Near ecosystem for the past 2 years. This time, I\\\\\\'ve sought the support of fellow Near members:\\\\n\\\\n1. Bernard D\\\\\\'sa (bernarddsa.near), who manages the creators DAO, RaindropsDAO, on Near.\\\\n2. Jackie (Jackierodz.near), who operates Paperless DAO and has published various books with other Near members.\\\\n\\\\nI\\\\\\'ve approached them for their support in bringing this mission to life, and they have agreed to join and support me in this endeavor.\\\\n\\\\nI have successfully directed a bootcamp and maintained ongoing communication with the Near India team, who expressed their support after observing the progress. However, I have not yet received any funding, which leads me to make a request for it here.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "impishlass.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "3500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "NEAR"}, "labels": []}

{"id": 33, "body": {"name": "RE:Public DevHub Proposal #1 - Milestone for April", "summary": "Re:public is a CI/CD automation tool for smart contract development, allowing deployments across multiple chains with a simple git push. You can see Re:public as Vercel for web3. \\\\n\\\\nWe successfully participated in the EthLondon hackathon, securing bounties from Near and Arbitrum, and we won\\\\u{2019}t stop there. We are deeply believe in idea of improving the developer experience, making it our top priority. \\\\n\\\\nOur main goal for this proposal - add \\\\\\\"bages and templates\\\\\\\" feature, as well as refactor code.", "category": "Tooling & Infrastructure", "timeline": {"status": "REJECTED", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "bpolania.near", "description": "## Overview\\\\nRe:public is a CI/CD automation tool for smart contract development, allowing deployments across multiple chains with a simple git push. You can see Re:public as GitLab or Vercel in web3 world.\\\\n\\\\nDesigned to streamline Web3 development, it eliminates the need for manual deployments across testnet chains. Utilizing NEAR cli tools and chain abstraction, it offers a seamless development process, reducing time-to-market and making blockchain development more accessible.\\\\n\\\\nWe successfully participated in the EthLondon hackathon, securing bounties from Near and Arbitrum, and we won\\\\u{2019}t stop there. We are deeply believe in idea of improving the developer experience, making it our top priority. \\\\n\\\\nWe created a working demo of Re:public in just two days during the hackathon, demonstrating our capability and drive. For more details, you can check out Re:public demo on ETHGlobal: [Re:public Showcase](https://ethglobal.com/showcase/re-public-4en9r)\\\\n\\\\n## Description\\\\n\\\\nOur project leverages NEAR cli tools and chain abstraction to deliver best CI experience for customers. Dockerized worker handles commits from connected repositories. Deploys them to the network and stores addresses. Chain abstraction allows to deploy projects to both near evm chains paying fees in NEAR tokens.\\\\n\\\\nThe core functionality of our project hinges on leveraging GitHub webhooks to capture various events, including app installations, commits, and pushes. Upon receiving an event, we populate our deployment queue. This queue is then processed by a background worker that is responsible for deploying the project across different blockchain networks, tailored to the specific requirements of each project type.\\\\n\\\\n## Who we are\\\\n\\\\nWe are experienced developers with an extensive development background, having several years of experience working in big tech companies, as well as creating and founding projects like [ZkNoid](https://zknoid.io/) and [xRaise](https://xraise.io/).\\\\n\\\\n## Milestone for this proposal (April 2024)\\\\n\\\\n1. **Code Revision and Refactoring:** Following our participation in the EthLondon Hackathon, it\\\\\\'s crucial to revisit and refine our code. We aim to transform prototyped app components into more robust, production-ready elements.\\\\n2. **Marketplace with Templates and \\\\\\'Badge Deploy\\\\\\':** We aspire to provide a \\\\\\'Vercel-like\\\\\\' user experience. Users should be able to deploy templates with a single \\\\\\'badge\\\\\\' click from any documentation or readme, mimicking the \\\\\\'Vercel deploy\\\\\\' functionality. This process will clone the selected template into the repository, handling its deployment and setup automatically.\\\\n3. **Customer Development:** We will engage in customer development.\\\\n\\\\n## How This Benefits the Near Ecosystem:\\\\n\\\\nAdvantages of the project for the Near ecosystem include:\\\\n\\\\n1. **Near Chain Signatures Utilization:** Our project heavily relies on and utilizes chain signatures. Deploying this tool in a production environment and working closely with Near dev/Devrel team, we will significantly enhance documentation and the developer experience for those using chain signatures. Our experimental use of chain signatures, such as contract deployments via Near signatures, will provide invaluable insights for the Near core development team, which will benefir all chain signature users.\\\\n2. **Focus on Deployment Experience on NEAR:** Our MVP will prioritize deployment experiences and CI/CD in the Near ecosystem. We aim to offer the best onboarding experience with template-based deployments similar to Vercel, enabling users to deploy a sandbox contract directly from Near documentation. This approach will simplify the onboarding process for developers new to the Near ecosystem.\\\\n3. **Seamless Gas Payment using Near token:** A key advantage of our project is the seamless gas payment mechanism in Near, which could increase transaction volumes on the Near network and enhance the liquidity of the Near token.\\\\n4. **Deployment on Alternative Networks utilising NEAR:** Successful execution of the project and the ability to deploy on alternative networks, like Solana, will distinguish Near from competitors, broaden the application scope of chain signatures, and reinforce Near\\\\\\'s reputation as a leading developer experience network.\\\\n5. **Benefiting All of Web3:** This project aims to enhance the development experience across the entire Web3 ecosystem, not just for Near. By simplifying the process of developing, testing, and deploying smart contracts, we make it more appealing for developers to engage with and commit to the Web3 space. The more user-friendly the development environment, the greater the incentive for developers to innovate within Web3\\\\n\\\\n## Roadmap for Re:public\\\\n\\\\n### **Q1 (April-May) 2024 - MVP**\\\\n\\\\n1. **Code Revision and Refactoring:** Following our participation in the EthLondon Hackathon, it\\\\\\'s crucial to revisit and refine our code. We aim to transform prototyped app components into more robust, production-ready elements.\\\\n2. **Marketplace with Templates and \\\\\\'Badge Deploy\\\\\\':** We aspire to provide a \\\\\\'Vercel-like\\\\\\' user experience. Users should be able to deploy templates with a single \\\\\\'badge\\\\\\' click from any documentation or readme, mimicking the \\\\\\'Vercel deploy\\\\\\' functionality. This process will clone the selected template into the repository, handling its deployment and setup automatically.\\\\n3. **Logging and Deployments Pages:** Implement features to view logs for each unique contract deployment, marking our initial steps toward observability within the app.\\\\n4. **Enhanced GitHub Integration:** Leveraging the GitHub API, we plan to enrich the developer experience by integrating comments and deployments directly on GitHub when relevant.\\\\n5. **Customer Development and Early Marketing:** We will engage in customer development and begin early-stage marketing efforts.\\\\n6. **Long-Term Monetization Strategy:** Begin to think on long-term monetization strategies.\\\\n7. **Early Stage MVP Release:** Launch an initial version of our Minimum Viable Product, focusing on Near ecosystem deployments.\\\\n\\\\n### **Q3 2024 - MLP**\\\\n\\\\n1. **HZN Accelerator and Fundraising:** Apply to the HZN accelerator and seek fundraising opportunities for the project.\\\\n2. **Continue to CustDev:** Enhance collaboration with smart contract developers on different chains\\\\n3. **Tracing/Monitoring Enhancements:** Develop a custom monitoring and tracing page, complemented by comprehensive logs.\\\\n4. **Multi-Chain Deployment Integration:** Start integrating deployment capabilities on other chains like Arbitrum and Polygon.\\\\n5. **Release of MLP:** Launch a fully functional and production-ready Minimal Lovable Product.\\\\n\\\\n### **Q4 2024**\\\\n\\\\n1. **Successful Fundraising:** Achieve our fundraising goals.\\\\n2. **Solana Deployments:** Implement deployment capabilities on Solana, utilizing Near chain signatures.\\\\n3. **In-House Multisig Control:** Centralize multisig control within the app.\\\\n4. **AI Contract Auditor:** Introduce an AI-based contract auditing feature.\\\\n5. **IPFS Integration:** Enable contract deployments with linked frontends on IPFS.\\\\n6. **Enhanced Access Control:** Implement precise access control mechanisms.\\\\n\\\\n## Funding\\\\n\\\\nWe are required 13k usdt, for April in our Q1 roadmap. This money would be enough for us to hire a team of 5 being able to work on MVP for 1 month: \\\\n\\\\n1x - Product Manager / Analyst / Business (we have a contact - 2000 usdt/month)\\\\n\\\\n2x - Fullstack Developers (approx 2500 usdt/month)\\\\n\\\\n2x - Founders (fundraising, cust devs, programming) (Me and Andrei - 2500 usdt/month)\\\\n\\\\nAll additional required exprenses (marketing, ads, etc) would be allocated from founders capital\\\\n\\\\nTotal amount = 13 000 usdt (2000 + 2500 * 2 + 2500 * 2 + 1000) for April 2024\\\\n\\\\n## Afterword\\\\n\\\\nWe truly believe that our project will become one of the key projects in the Near ecosystem and can significantly influence the further success of Near in the web3 space. We received a lot of positive feedback at the hackathon from fellow hackers, builders, and programmers, and we know that the project will be in demand.\\\\n\\\\nAs developers, we possess the ability to communicate effectively in the language of our peers, and I believe we have the capability to develop a product that will play a crucial role in advancing the field of development both on the Near platform and within the broader Web3 ecosystem. This project is not just about promoting Near; it\\\\\\'s about advancing the entirety of the Web3 landscape. We are hopeful that this proposal will mark the beginning of our collaborative journey with Near.\\\\n\\\\nEthLondon Showcase:  https://ethglobal.com/showcase/re-public-4en9r\\\\n\\\\nOur Twitter: https://twitter.com/re_public_dev\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "madlime.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "13000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": []}

{"body": {"name": "Devrel Activities by Boris Polania (April 21 - May 03)", "summary": "This is the summary of my activities for the specified period", "category": "DevDAO Operations", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": "theori.near", "description": "Devrel Activities by Boris Polania (April 21 - May 03)\\\\n\\\\nThis is the summary of my activities for the specified period\\\\n\\\\n## Planned Activities\\\\nThe following activities will be completed from April 21 - May 03. \\\\n\\\\n### Devhub Activities (18 hours)\\\\n* Proposal Reviews and Approvals (4 hours)\\\\n* Devhub Internal Meetings (6 hours)\\\\n* Devrels 2024 Proposals & roadmap (8 hours)\\\\n### DevRel Activities (43 hours) \\\\n* Internal Meetings: weekly standup, 1-on-1 meetings with contributors. (2 hours)\\\\n* Content: Articles, Scaffolds, etc. (35 hours)\\\\n* General Support in telegram, discord, etc. (6 hours)\\\\n### Events (18 hours)\\\\n* Q1 Post Event - Social Networks, prizes, etc.  (2 hours)\\\\n* Dominion - IRL Event (8 hours)\\\\n* Events Committee - Hackathon Manual (2 hours)\\\\n* Bounty Booster Rules Launch (6)\\\\n### NEAR Campus (1 hour)\\\\n* Phasing-out meetings and final proposal closing (1 hours)\\\\n### Timeline\\\\n* Start Date: 04/08/2024\\\\n* End Date: 04/19/2024\\\\n### Requested Funding\\\\n* Total hours: 80 hours\\\\n* Rate: $100/hour\\\\n* Total amount: $8,000 USD\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "bpolania.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "8000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": []}

{"proposal": {"id": 76, "snapshot": {"name": "Devrel Activities by Boris Polania (April 21 - May 03)", "labels": [], "summary": "This is the summary of my activities for the specified period", "category": "DevDAO Operations", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "editor_id": "bpolania.near", "timestamp": "1715113046918469107", "supervisor": "theori.near", "description": "Devrel Activities by Boris Polania (April 21 - May 03)\\\\n\\\\nThis is the summary of my activities for the specified period\\\\n\\\\n## Planned Activities\\\\nThe following activities will be completed from April 21 - May 03. \\\\n\\\\n### Devhub Activities (18 hours)\\\\n* Proposal Reviews and Approvals (4 hours)\\\\n* Devhub Internal Meetings (6 hours)\\\\n* Devrels 2024 Proposals & roadmap (8 hours)\\\\n### DevRel Activities (43 hours) \\\\n* Internal Meetings: weekly standup, 1-on-1 meetings with contributors. (2 hours)\\\\n* Content: Articles, Scaffolds, etc. (35 hours)\\\\n* General Support in telegram, discord, etc. (6 hours)\\\\n### Events (18 hours)\\\\n* Q1 Post Event - Social Networks, prizes, etc.  (2 hours)\\\\n* Dominion - IRL Event (8 hours)\\\\n* Events Committee - Hackathon Manual (2 hours)\\\\n* Bounty Booster Rules Launch (6)\\\\n### NEAR Campus (1 hour)\\\\n* Phasing-out meetings and final proposal closing (1 hours)\\\\n### Timeline\\\\n* Start Date: 04/08/2024\\\\n* End Date: 04/19/2024\\\\n### Requested Funding\\\\n* Total hours: 80 hours\\\\n* Rate: $100/hour\\\\n* Total amount: $8,000 USD\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "bpolania.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "8000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "author_id": "bpolania.near", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}
